Drakeâ€™s â€œMore Lifeâ€ Gets â€œDeliveredâ€ In Time For Release March 17, 2017 | 2:13 PM 12 
While the world has already been patiently waiting on Drakeâ€™s highly anticipated album, More Life, it looks like his fans might finally get it on schedule. (Or at least the latest schedule â€” not all those other schedules .) 
OVO Sound producer/engineer Noah Shebib took to Twitter Friday afternoon to announce the project was delivered. At least weâ€™re assuming heâ€™s talking about the project being delivered and not a pizza for him to eat while he tinkers with the playlist order for another three weeks. Delivered ğŸŒº 
â€” Noah Shebib (@OVO40) March 17, 2017 
Shebib had raised eyebrows with another tweet early Friday morning (March 17) that had some wondering if heâ€™d get it in ahead of the March 18 deadline. Almost doneâ€¦

The tweets come almost a week after the illustrious Toronto artist â€œpromisedâ€ he was finishing the projects playlist during A Boy Meets World tour stop in Hamburg, Germany. The release date has been the subject of several broken promises and much speculation, all without even an official tracklist surfacing. Dreezy has, however, kept the fans pacified with tracks like â€œHush Up The Silenceâ€ featuring WizKid, â€œTwo Birds One Stone,â€ â€œFake Loveâ€ and the 21 Savage-assisted â€œSneakinâ€™.â€ 
Due to the monumental success of his last album, VIEWS, OVO is presumably feeling the pressure to top it, which could account for the multiple delays. Perhaps theyâ€™re just fine-tuning the final product. Whatever the case, More Life will be here, most likely, before the end of 2017.
